MAHADEVAN (Applied Mathematics, Harvard University): Wrinkle, wrinkle on my skin, how I wonder did you begin?
By sagging and swelling and shrinking too, while stretching and bending or mixed into a brew, until, aha, a formula that sits on a pin.
How infinitely familiar, how far from (unintelligible) environment is.
And no one reminds us of this every day besides our children.
So I thank them all particularly our two (unintelligible).
Wrinkle, wrinkle on my skin, where I wonder did I sin?
Celebrated an art drapery until, aha, pruned by surgery and then just a has-been.
(Soundbite of applause)
The Chemistry Prize.
(Soundbite of music)

The Ig Nobel Chemistry Prize of this year is presented to Mayu Yamamoto of the International Medical Center of Japan for developing a way to extract vanillin, the flavor and fragrance of vanilla, from cow dung.
(Soundbite of laughter)
Here is Mayu Yamamoto.
(Soundbite of applause)
Thank you.
Peace, mate.
(Soundbite of laughter)
What kind of smell you encounter when the cow dung are heated?
Can you imagine that?
It's a very strange and sweet.
Please eat ice cream with cow dung.
Thank you.
(Soundbite of cheering)
Now, here is a special tribute to Mayu Yamamoto.
Please welcome, Gus Rancatore, the owner of Toscanini's ice cream.
(Soundbite of cheering)
Thank you very much.
This was a very difficult year in the ice cream business.
There were dramatic increases in dairy costs and real estate costs, and Ms. Yamamoto's achievement stood out like a lantern.
And Toscanini's was inspired enough to imitate her achievement.
And we have samples for the laureates.

Eat it, eat it, eat it, eat it, eat itâ€¦

The next 24/7 lecture will be delivered by Jill Lepore, professor of history at Harvard University.
Her topic: history.
(Soundbite of laughter)
To clap and go woo-hoo.

History is in an enduring travel to an archive repository or a library, bring in pencil, fill out little (unintelligible); be the chicken scratch of letters, diaries, love notes, speeches, scrapbooks, (unintelligible), unopened mails, stranger and wondrous people you've never met and never will but you probably should could have.
Find out everything you can about how they understood why hens lay eggs.
Think about it.
Think about it some more, and then make up some cock-and-ball story.
(Soundbite of applause)
And now a clear summary that anyone can understand in seven words.
On your mark, get set, go.
History is the study of dead people.
(Soundbite of cheering)
The next 24/7 lecture will be delivered by Fariba Houman, the interim director of human subjects administration at the Harvard School of Public Health.
Her topic: research ethics.
First, a complete technical description in 24 seconds.
On your mark, get set, go.

The ethical conduct of non-exempt human subjects research is governed by set of rules fortified by 45-C and 446; in a phase two trial of avian flu vaccine in a cohort of handlers - animal handlers of broiler chickens.
(Soundbite of cheering)
And now, a clear summary that anyone can understand in seven words.
On your mark, get set go.
Research on animal handlers needs IRB approval.
(Soundbite of applause)
The final 24/7 lecture will be delivered by Nobel laureate William Lipscomb.
His topic: chicken.
(Soundbite of applause)
First, complete technical summary in 24 seconds.
On your mark, get set, go.
It is very surprising how many references there are in the Internet for chicken.
(Soundbite of audience)
Unbelievable.
I could go through them, but I don't have much time here.
(Soundbite of audience laughing)
No one has asked why a chicken crosses the road - to go across the road.
(Soundbite of whistle)
Uh-oh.
(Soundbite of laughter)
And now, a sclear summary that anyone can understand in seven words.
On your mark, get set, go.
Chicken lays egg.
It's a standing ovation.
(Soundbite of laughter and applause)
The Igs are a tribute to the good, the bad and the ugly in science - or at least the strange, silly and the unusual.
Where else would levitating frogs, pink plastic flamingos and the beauty preferences of chicken find the highest honors?
The awards were handed out on early October at Harvard's Sanders Theatre.
(Soundbite of applause)
